name: Jamie Foxx
description:
'''Eric Marlon Bishop''' (born December 13, 1967), known professionally as '''Jamie Foxx''', is an American actor, comedian, and singer. Known for his work in both [[Jamie Foxx filmography|the screen]] and [[Jamie Foxx discography|music industries]], [[List of awards and nominations received by Jamie Foxx|his accolades]] include an [[Academy Award]], a [[Grammy Award]], a [[British Academy Film Award]], and a [[Golden Globe Award]]. Foxx's [[breakthrough role|breakthrough]] was in the early 1990s as a featured player in the sketch comedy show ''[[In Living Color]]'' (1991{{ndash}}1994). Following this success, he co-created, produced and starred in his own titular [[sitcom]], ''[[The Jamie Foxx Show]]'' (1996{{ndash}}2001).

After a series of successful early film roles, Foxx received acclaim and [[List of actors nominated for multiple Academy Awards in the same year|dual Academy Award nominations]] for his performances in the biopic ''[[Ray (film)|Ray]]'' and the crime thriller ''[[Collateral (film)|Collateral]]'' (both 2004); [[List of black Academy Award winners and nominees|the only black actor]] to do so. He won [[Academy Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] for his portrayal of [[Ray Charles]] in the former. Foxx also received recognition that year for his portrayal of [[Stanley Williams|the titular gangster]] in the [[television film]] ''[[Redemption: The Stan Tookie Williams Story]]'', which earned him another Golden Globe nomination. He went on to star in further films, such as ''[[Jarhead (film)|Jarhead]]'' (2005), ''[[Dreamgirls (film)|Dreamgirls]]'' (2006), ''[[Miami Vice (film)|Miami Vice]]'' (2006), ''[[Horrible Bosses]]'' (2011), ''[[Django Unchained]]'' (2012), ''[[Annie (2014 film)|Annie]]'' (2014), ''[[Baby Driver]]'' (2017), and ''[[Soul (2020 film)|Soul]]'' (2020). He also played [[Electro (Marvel Comics)|Electro]] in ''[[The Amazing Spider-Man 2]]'' (2014) and ''[[Spider-Man: No Way Home]]'' (2021) and [[Walter McMillian]] in ''[[Just Mercy]]'' (2019); the latter earned him a nomination for the [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Supporting Role|SAG Award for Best Supporting Actor]].

Outside of acting, Foxx also embarked on a successful career as an [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] singer in the 2000s. He earned two number-one singles on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], with his features on the singles "[[Slow Jamz]]" by [[Twista]] alongside [[Kanye West]], and "[[Gold Digger (Kanye West song)|Gold Digger]]" by the former. His single "[[Blame It]]" won him the [[Grammy Award for Best R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals]]. Four of his five studio albums have charted in the top ten of the U.S. [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]: ''[[Unpredictable (Jamie Foxx album)|Unpredictable]]'' (2005), which topped the chart, ''[[Intuition (Jamie Foxx album)|Intuition]]'' (2008), ''[[Best Night of My Life]]'' (2010), and ''[[Hollywood: A Story of a Dozen Roses]]'' (2015). Since 2017, Foxx has served as the host and executive producer of the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] game show ''[[Beat Shazam]]''. In 2021, he wrote his autobiography ''Act Like You Got Some Sense''.
